intro: Carpodiptera sansibarensis, commonly known as the Zanzibar moonflower, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the island of Zanzibar. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is known for its ornamental value. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth texture and dark green color. Due to habitat loss and over-collection, it is considered endangered and is protected in some regions.
